forumNotes.author: was_jaclaz
forumNotes.content:
Easyboot, besides being COMMERCIAL software :tongue: , is a tool related to building ONLY boot CD's and DVD's, **NOT** HD, USB sticks or USB hard disks.  

There are a fair number of tools, both Commercial and Open Source that fall into the category of "bootmanagers" that ONLY work on FD or HD like devices.  

Of these, among the Freeware ones I can mention partita:  
[http://www.pedrofrei...om/crea1_en.htm](http://www.pedrofreire.com/crea1_en.htm "External link")  
and mrbldr:  
[http://www.boot-land...mbldr-t334.html](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/OS-BS-ride...mbldr-t334.html "External link")  
the distinctive advantage of these two is that they both fit completely in the MBR (512 bytes), so they are theoretically compatible with ALL partition managing software, unlike some other ones that occupy some of the "hidden" sectors of first track.  

On the contrary Grub4DOS, GPL, is a tool specific to HD's and similar devices that can ALSO be used on bootable CD's.  

The good thing about Grub4dos is the fact that it can be run fro either DOS (grub.exe) or from BOOT.INI (grldr) through NTLDR, so that you won't need to even touch the MBR.  

The syntax is more "logical" than most other bootmanagers and the same menu.lst can be used on floppy, CD or HD type of devices, and it is of course fully compatible with any kind of Linux.  

jaclaz

forumNotes.author: was_jaclaz
forumNotes.content:
Yes, that's normal, you CANNOT have more than one PRIMARY partition visible to DOS. The question here is two (actually three) folded: 1) WHY do you need to have more than one partition? 2) WHY, IF more than one partition is needed, from second on they cannot be Logical Volumes inside Extended Partition? 2a) WHY, IF more than one partition is needed, AND from second on they cannot be Logical Volumes inside Extended Partition, do they need to "see" each other?
Please, do not take it as an offence :tongue: , but maybe you need a little bit of study on MBR's, Partitioning and limits of each OS (mainly DOS), some good links are: [http://www.ranish.com/part/primer.htm](http://www.ranish.com/part/primer.htm "External link") [http://pclt.cis.yale...OT/PARTITIO.HTM](http://pclt.cis.yale.edu/pclt/BOOT/PARTITIO.HTM "External link") [http://thestarman.pcministry.com/](http://thestarman.pcministry.com/ "External link") [http://home.att.net/...oot/pc_boot.htm](http://home.att.net/~rayknights/pc_boot/pc_boot.htm "External link") [http://www.goodells....iboot/notes.htm](http://www.goodells.net/multiboot/notes.htm "External link")
And, though not so good, my page here: [http://home.graffiti...B/USBstick.html](http://home.graffiti.net/jaclaz:graffiti.n...B/USBstick.html "External link") explains a bit about USB stick booting jaclaz
